title: Don't Believe What Consumers Say When It Comes to Sustainability - The Business of Fashion
summary: This article explores the gap between consumers' expressed desire for sustainable fashion and their actual purchasing behavior. Despite surveys indicating a growing preference for eco-conscious brands, the reality is that shoppers still heavily favor cheap, fast-fashion options. The article identifies several factors contributing to this discrepancy, including the unreliability of consumer surveys, the difficulty of defining 'sustainable' fashion, and the vested interests of companies promoting sustainability.
